snippet: Hundreds of civilians were allowed to leave Moadhamiyeh, outside Damascus, but aid workers said they were still unable to enter the besieged town, where six people have reportedly died of malnutrition.
abstract: Hundreds of people are allowed to leave rebel-held suburb of Damascus, Syria, during rare cease-fire; aid workers report they are still unable to enter town,  which international organizations have been trying to reach for months; six people have reportedly died of malnutrition in the town, Moadhamiyeh.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of civilians were allowed to leave Moadhamiyeh, outside Damascus, but aid workers said they were still unable to enter the besieged town, where six people have reportedly died of malnutrition.

headline.main: In Rare Cease-Fire, Hundreds Evacuate Rebel-Held Syrian Town
headline.print_headline: In Rare Cease-Fire, Hundreds Evacuate Rebel-Held Syrian Town
